title: Stars win, oust Presidents' Trophy-winning Jets
content: Defenseman Thomas Harley scored on a power play 1:33 into overtime as the Stars advanced to the Western Conference finals for the third season in a row, beating the top-seeded Jets 2-1 in Game 6 to set up a date with the Oilers.

title: Clark, new-look Fever rout Sky in chippy opener
content: The Fever started their season Saturday with a blowout victory over the Sky, a triple-double from Caitlin Clark, a career milestone for Fever newcomer DeWanna Bonner and a kerfuffle between Clark and the Sky's Angel Reese.

title: Scheffler catches fire at PGA, takes 3-shot lead
content: Scottie Scheffler delivered a clinic over the closing stretch at Quail Hollow for a 6-under 65 and a three-shot lead going into the final round of the PGA Championship.

title: Furious finish lifts Journalism to Preakness win
content: Journalism won the Preakness Stakes on Saturday, coming from behind down the stretch to make good on the lofty expectations of being the favorite in the middle leg of the Triple Crown two weeks after finishing second to Sovereignty in the Kentucky Derby.

title: Sources: Celts' Brown has partial meniscus tear
content: Celtics star Jaylen Brown finished the season with a partially torn right meniscus and will be evaluated this coming week to determine if surgery is needed, sources told ESPN.

title: Scheifele plays, scores hours after losing father
content: Winnipeg Jets center Mark Scheifele scored a goal -- and committed a critical third-period penalty -- in his club's season-deciding 2-1 overtime loss to the Dallas Stars on Saturday night in Game 6, a defeat that ended this second-round playoff series.

title: Happy at DH, Devers stays hot with walk-off HR
content: Rafael Devers, who has been hot at the plate after a historically slow start, hit his first career walk-off Saturday night to send the Red Sox to a 7-6 comeback win over the Braves.

title: Twins win 13th in row behind 3rd straight shutout
content: Pablo Lopez combined with three relievers on a three-hitter as the Twins beat the Brewers 7-0 on Saturday for their third straight shutout and 13th consecutive victory.

title: With a three-shot lead, Scottie Scheffler looks inevitable
content: After a torrid finish to his third round, Scheffler is in full control. Can anyone make it a contest on Sunday?

title: 'He turned his back on us': What it was like watching Juan Soto's Bronx return with the Bleacher Creatures
content: Betrayal. Crossed-out jerseys. And a boatload of expletives. Inside a wild Subway Series as a former Yankees hero returns a hated Met.

title: Morales puts division on notice with TKO of Burns
content: Michael Morales stamped himself as a real threat in the welterweight division with an impressive TKO.

title: How Boston avoids breaking up its roster, plus offseason guides for every NBA team
content: NBA front office insider Bobby Marks breaks down the summer priorities and needs for every eliminated team.

title: Stanley Cup playoffs daily: Who wins Game 7 of Panthers-Maple Leafs?
content: The winner heads to the conference finals; the loser an early vacation. Here are key players, score picks.

title: Nothing is impossible: Crystal Palace's first FA Cup win over Man City proves that
content: Crystal Palace win their first major trophy in 120 years by winning the FA Cup, while a possible rebuild for Manchester City becomes more evident.

title: Pep: 'Don't know' why Haaland didn't take pen
content: Pep Guardiola admitted he thought Erling Haaland would take Manchester City's penalty during their FA Cup final defeat to Crystal Palace and revealed it was "decided on the pitch" that Omar Marmoush would step up before his miss.

title: Henderson on avoiding red card: 'Who cares?'
content: Crystal Palace goalkeeper Dean Henderson said, "Who cares?" and insisted he knew he would save Omar Marmoush's penalty after an FA Cup final red card reprieve.

title: USMNT's Richards: FA Cup win means world to me
content: Alabama-native Chris Richards hailed his unlikely journey to becoming just the second American to play in and win an FA Cup final on Saturday.

title: Madrid confirm Huijsen signing; to play in CWC
content: Real Madrid have completed the signing of Bournemouth defender Dean Huijsen, the LaLiga club have confirmed.

title: Leverkusen set record with Alonso set to depart
content: Bayer Leverkusen came from a goal down to rescue a 2-2 draw at hosts Mainz 05 in the Bundesliga finale on Saturday and hand departing coach Xabi Alonso another record as they went two league seasons without an away defeat.

title: Gyökeres leads Sporting to title with 39th goal
content: Star striker Viktor Gyökeres helped to lead Sporting CP to their second consecutive Portuguese league title after Benfica was held off on the final day of the season on Saturday.

title: Fastest to 25: Chawinga sets NWSL scoring record
content: Temwa Chawinga's goal on Friday night secured a 1-0 win for the Kansas City Current against the Orlando Pride, making her the quickest player in NWSL history to reach 25 goals.

title: 49ers QB Brock Purdy is no longer Mr. Irrelevant: New contract comes with pressure to lead, win
content: San Francisco has long benefited from the league's best bargain contract. Now, it's on Purdy to deliver results.

title: How Alexis DeBoer has made a name for herself with Washington softball
content: While her famous dad went to Alabama to coach the Tide, Alexis DeBoer followed her dream to play for the Huskies.

title: A'ja Wilson leads WNBA's best dressed on opening weekend
content: Before the WNBA's best take the floor, they dazzled the pregame tunnel with their opening-night outfits.

title: Who are the best coaches in college football? We rank the top 10
content: Kirby Smart has to be No. 1, or does he? What about Ryan Day? Or Marcus Freeman? Who made our list -- and why.

title: Derek Carr retired, then an avalanche of unanswered questions followed
content: Derek Carr surprisingly announced his retirement on May 10. The decision -- and the timing -- has insiders throughout the league talking.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man City to spend £180m to land Wirtz and Reijnders
content: Manchester City will spend big to make sure they land Florian Wirtz and Tijjani Reijnders. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Top LeT terrorist behind 3 major attacks on India killed in Pakistan's Sindh
content: Top Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) terrorist Razaullah Nizamani, also known as Abu Saiullah, responsible for attacks in India, has been killed by unidentified gunmen in Pakistan's Sindh province. Nizamani, who had government-provided security, was shot near a crossing after leaving his residence. This incident follows the neutralization of nearly 100 terrorists by Indian Armed Forces in Operation Sindoor.

title: Assam CM makes explosive claim on Cong MP Gogoi's Pak visit
content: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma has accused Congress MP Gaurav Gogoi of visiting Pakistan on ISI's invitation for training, alleging close ties with the Pakistani establishment. Sarma claims to possess solid evidence, promising its release by September 10. Gogoi refuted the allegations, questioning Sarma's potential resignation if the claims are unproven.

title: After India raises red flag, IMF issues warning & sets 11 new riders for Pak bailout
content: The IMF has imposed 11 new conditions on Pakistan's bailout program, raising the total to 50, and cautioned that escalating tensions with India could jeopardize fiscal and reform objectives. These conditions include parliamentary approval of the federal budget, agricultural income tax reforms, and liberalization of used car imports.

title: US Embassy in India issues warning of permanent ban on traveling: If you...
content: The U.S. Embassy in India has issued a warning about the consequences of overstaying visas. Indian citizens traveling to the U.S. on work, student, or tourist visas risk deportation and a permanent ban if they remain beyond their authorized stay.

title: Criticised for being overweight, Sarfaraz sheds 10 kg ahead of England tour
content: Sarfaraz Khan, often criticized for his weight, is now prioritizing fitness. Despite Sunil Gavaskar's defense of his performance over physique, Sarfaraz has shed 10 kg in a month, spurred by his India A selection and IPL snub.

title: Nusraat Faria, who played Sheikh Hasina in Mujib biopic, arrested in Dhaka: Reports
content: Nusraat Faria, the actress who portrayed Sheikh Hasina in the biopic "Mujib: The Making of a Nation," has been arrested at Dhaka airport. The arrest is linked to an attempted murder case filed during anti-government protests in August 2024, which led to the fall of Sheikh Hasina's government. Faria was reportedly attempting to travel to Thailand when she was apprehended.

title: Microsoft's fired AI director to 6,000 laid off employees: "These are people who…"
content: Microsoft recently laid off approximately 6,000 employees, impacting various levels and teams. Gabriela de Queiroz, Director of AI for Startups, was among those affected, expressing sadness but maintaining a positive outlook. The layoffs coincide with Microsoft's aggressive push into AI, even as software engineers and AI leadership roles were impacted by the cuts.

title: Yashasvi's carnage leaves Arshdeep with IPL record he'd rather forget
content: Yashasvi Jaiswal's explosive start, smashing 22 runs in the first over against Arshdeep Singh, set the tone for Rajasthan Royals' chase after Punjab Kings posted a formidable 219/5. Arshdeep's expensive over became a record he'd rather forget, overshadowing impressive batting performances from Nehal Wadhera and Shashank Singh for Punjab.

title: 'Tharoor looking for berth ...': CPI Kerala slams Cong MP
content: CPI Kerala Secretary Binoy Viswam criticized Shashi Tharoor for leading a delegation to brief partner countries on terrorism, suggesting Tharoor seeks a place within BJP's influence in Congress. Tharoor defended his acceptance, citing national interest and a request from Kiren Rijiju, while Congress nominated other representatives like Anand Sharma and Gaurav Gogoi for the delegation.

title: Microsoft CEO Says Only DeepSeek R1 Rivals OpenAI—Not Google or xAI
content: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella lauded DeepSeek's R1 as a formidable competitor to OpenAI's models, surpassing even Google's Gemini in performance. This recognition, along with praise from OpenAI's Sam Altman and Google's Sundar Pichai, highlights DeepSeek's significant impact on the AI landscape. R1's cost-effectiveness has stirred market concerns about AI hardware demand.

title: Curran breaks silence on 'crying like a child' claim amid Indo-Pak tensions
content: England's Tom Curran has refuted claims that he was seen crying at the airport due to India-Pakistan tensions, which disrupted cricket schedules. These rumours originated from Rishad Hossain's comments, but Curran addressed them humorously on Instagram, denying any emotional breakdown. Hossain has since apologised for his misrepresentation, and with tensions easing, the PSL is set to resume.

title: 17 killed in fire at a building in Hyderabad; PM Modi condoles deaths
content: A significant fire erupted early Sunday in Guzar House, near Hyderabad's Charminar, prompting a swift emergency response. Fire department officials, alerted around 6:30 am, found numerous unconscious individuals within the building. Approximately 20 people were rushed to nearby hospitals for treatment, according to an AIMIM legislator who visited the site.

title: 'He didn't look back': Shastri's bold call that transformed Rohit's Test career
content: Ravi Shastri revealed that a hunch during the 2019 World Cup led to Rohit Sharma's promotion to Test opener. Shastri believed Rohit's aggressive ODI approach could translate to Test success, convincing Virat Kohli to implement the change. Rohit seized the opportunity, scoring twin centuries in his first match as opener and transforming his Test career.

title: Rajasthan Royals' Fazalhaq Farooqi creates unwanted record in IPL 2025
content: Rajasthan Royals' pacer Fazalhaq Farooqi is facing a tough IPL 2025 season, having gone wicketless in 17 overs across four matches, conceding 210 runs. Despite his recent struggles, he was previously a top T20 wicket-taker and excelled in the 2024 T20 World Cup.

title: Neeraj reacts to PM Modi’s message after 90m throw at Doha DL
content: Neeraj Chopra made history at the Doha Diamond League 2025. He became the first Indian to cross the 90-metre mark in javelin. His throw measured 90.23 metres. Julian Weber of Germany won the event. Prime Minister Narendra Modi congratulated Neeraj. Neeraj aims for even greater distances in future competitions. He is preparing for the World Championships and Paris 2024 Olympics.

title: Watch: Amit Shah leads 'Tiranga Yatra' in Ahmedabad
content: Amit Shah led a 'Tiranga Yatra' in Ahmedabad to celebrate Operation Sindoor's success, honouring the armed forces for eradicating terrorism. The BJP organized the yatra from May 13-23, commemorating the operation launched in response to the Pahalgam terror attack.

title: YouTuber held for spying: 'Jyoti hid ISI operatives' numbers under fake IDs'
content: Haryana police arrested travel vlogger Jyoti Malhotra from Hisar for allegedly spying and sharing sensitive information with Pakistani intelligence. She is accused of circulating pro-Pakistan content and maintaining encrypted contact with Pakistani operatives. Police seized her devices and are investigating her bank records, marking the seventh espionage-related arrest in the region since May 7.

title: Shreyas Iyer fights through finger Injury, scores gritty 30 against RR
content: Despite a painful finger injury sustained during practice, Punjab Kings captain Shreyas Iyer scored a valuable 30 runs off 25 balls against Rajasthan Royals. Iyer's innings helped stabilize Punjab's innings after an early collapse, forming a crucial partnership with Nehal Wadhera. The match also featured a tribute to the Indian armed forces, with players and fans expressing their gratitude.

title: With Op Sindoor still on, military gets emergency purchase powers
content: Amidst tensions with Pakistan and a strategic pause in Operation Sindoor, India has granted its armed forces emergency procurement powers with a budget of approximately Rs 40,000 crore. This move allows the Army, IAF, and Navy to quickly replenish arms stockpiles and acquire advanced weaponry like missiles, drones, and precision-guided munitions.

title: Winnipeg Jets center Mark Scheifele scores in playoff loss after father's death
content: Mark Scheifele of the Winnipeg Jets played Game 6 against the Dallas Stars shortly after his father's death. He scored the Jets' lone goal in the heartbreaking 2-1 overtime loss, ending their Stanley Cup hopes. Despite personal tragedy, Scheifele's courageous performance and the team's support highlighted the emotional night, with condolences extended by both teams.

title: Watch: Emotional tribute to Armed Forces marks IPL 2025 resumption
content: The IPL 2025 made a poignant return after a week-long suspension due to India-Pakistan tensions, commencing with heartfelt tributes to the armed forces. Rajasthan Royals and Punjab Kings united for the national anthem in Jaipur, honouring the soldiers' bravery. Following a washout in Bengaluru, the league's resumption symbolized resilience and gratitude for the nation's defenders.

title: Forced to destroy! US rejects mango shipments from India
content: US authorities have rejected fifteen mango shipments from India at various airports due to documentation irregularities concerning mandatory irradiation treatment. Exporters face approximately $500,000 in losses as they were compelled to dispose of the fruit locally due to high re-exportation costs.

title: 'Russia's goal is to eliminate causes of Ukraine war': Putin
content: Vladimir Putin stated Russia's aim to eliminate the causes of the Ukraine war and ensure Russia's security, coinciding with a record drone attack on Ukraine. Despite recent diplomatic talks in Istanbul, which yielded a prisoner exchange agreement, no ceasefire was reached.

title: India’s smartphone exports outpace petrol & diamonds to top export chart
content: India's smartphone exports have surged, surpassing petroleum products and diamonds to become the nation's top export. Driven by policy incentives and rising demand, shipments climbed 55% to $24.14 billion in 2024-25. The US and Japan are major contributors, with exports to the US jumping fivefold.

title: SC guv verdict: 'Must unite for legal battle', Stalin tells non-BJP state CMs
content: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin urged non-BJP ruled states to unite against the Centre's alleged attempt to undermine the Supreme Court's verdict regarding the governor's role. President Murmu sought SC's opinion on its ruling that set deadlines for governors acting on bills. Stalin accused the BJP of using the President to challenge the judgment, potentially impacting states facing uncooperative governors.

title: Father defends alleged 'spy' YouTuber: 'Can't she call Pak friends?'
content: Jyoti Malhotra, a YouTuber, has been arrested by Haryana Police on suspicion of espionage. Her father claims she visited Pakistan solely for YouTube content creation with proper permissions. Police allege Malhotra was in contact with Pakistani intelligence, met an officer in Delhi, and shared sensitive information. Authorities seized phones and laptops, registering a case under the Official Secrets Act.

title: Jaishankar to visit Netherlands, Denmark, and Germany for bilateral talks
content: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar is embarking on a six-day visit to the Netherlands, Denmark, and Germany starting May 19. Discussions will encompass bilateral relations and global matters. His Germany visit aligns with Friedrich Merz's new role as Federal Chancellor, signaling continued commitment to the India-Germany Strategic Partnership.

title: Hyderabad's retired IAS officer falls victim to cyber fraud, loses Rs 3 crore
content: A 72-year-old retired IAS officer from Hyderabad fell victim to a sophisticated cyber fraud, losing Rs 3.37 crore through a fake stock trading app. Lured by promises of high returns and AI-driven investment strategies, the officer transferred funds over several months.

title: Ashoka University professor arrested for remarks on Operation Sindoor
content: Ali Khan Mahmudabad, an associate professor at Ashoka University, was arrested following a social media post concerning Operation Sindoor. The arrest, prompted by a complaint from a BJP Yuva Morcha leader, relates to Mahmudabad's remarks about the operation. The Haryana state commission for women had previously issued a notice regarding his comments, which he claims were misunderstood and not anti-women.

title: IPL 2025: RCB announces ticket refunds for abandoned KKR match
content: Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) has announced full refunds for ticket holders of the rain-abandoned match against Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) on May 17. Digital ticket holders will receive refunds within 10 working days, while physical ticket holders must return their original tickets at the point of purchase.

title: Russia launches one of biggest drone attacks on Ukraine since war started
content: Russia launched a massive drone attack on Ukraine, deploying 273 drones and decoys, surpassing previous records. Ukrainian air defenses intercepted 88 drones, while electronic interference neutralized 128. The strikes resulted in one death and three injuries in the Kyiv region.

title: Will gold prices drop to Rs 88,000 per 10 grams? Experts see downside
content: Gold prices are under pressure, having fallen 7% from their April high, testing a crucial support level. Analysts suggest further declines are possible if key support levels break, influenced by reduced expectations for US rate cuts and diminished trade war concerns.

title: Balasaheb helped Amit Shah get bail, claims Sanjay Raut in his book
content: Sanjay Raut's new book, ‘Narkatla Swarg', alleges Bal Thackeray helped Amit Shah secure bail in an encounter case and Sharad Pawar opposed Narendra Modi's arrest after the Godhra riots. The book launch, attended by prominent opposition leaders, sparked controversy, with BJP leaders demanding investigation into Raut's claims about judicial process.

title: Another techie dies post hair transplant by same Kanpur doctor
content: Following the death of engineer Vineet Dubey after a hair transplant, another case has emerged in Kanpur. Mayank Katiyar, a techie from Farrukhabad, died within 24 hours of undergoing a similar procedure by the same female doctor at a private hospital. His mother has now sought action against the doctor, alleging negligence and abandonment after complications arose post-transplant.

title: 'Conspired to commit terror acts': NIA arrests two Isis members at Mumbai airport
content: The NIA arrested two absconders, Abdullah Faiyaz Shaikh and Talha Khan, at Mumbai airport upon their arrival from Jakarta. They are key members of an ISIS sleeper module involved in fabricating IEDs in Pune back in 2023.

title: PDP slams Omar over call to scrap Indus Waters Treaty
content: The PDP has strongly criticized Omar Abdullah's remarks regarding the Tulbul Navigation Project and the Indus Waters Treaty, cautioning that such statements could destabilize the fragile peace along the Line of Control. The party deemed Abdullah's comments as irresponsible, especially given the current volatile climate.

title: Watch: Chaos as Mexican ship collides with Brooklyn Bridge, sailors seen dangling
content: Tragedy struck as the Mexican Navy training ship Cuauhtémoc collided with the Brooklyn Bridge, resulting in two fatalities and injuring at least seventeen others. The ship, carrying 277 people, reportedly lost power, causing its masts to strike the bridge. Eyewitnesses described a chaotic scene with sailors dangling from the damaged masts.

title: 'Letting go is not appreciated in our country': Sanjay Bangar on Virat Kohli
content: Virat Kohli's unexpected retirement from Test cricket has elicited varied reactions, with former coach Ravi Shastri suggesting mental fatigue. Sanjay Bangar, ex-batting coach, expressed sadness but respected Kohli's conviction, acknowledging his significant impact on Indian cricket. Kohli's 14-year Test career saw him amass 9,230 runs, transforming India into a formidable force.

title: Andhra Pradesh government plans to spend ₹16 crore for the improvement of minor irrigation facilities in Parvatipuram-Manyam district, says Collector
content: ‘The initiative is expected to benefit a large number of farmers as majority of areas in the district come under rain-fed zone’

title: Seed balls to heal forests and prevent wildlife conflicts in Kerala
content: The eco-friendly capsules are aimed at enriching natural food sources within forest areas, thereby reducing the incentive for animals to venture into human habitats. The project will be conducted from June 15 to August 15.

title: Erwadi panchayat residents seek basic amenities amid ongoing infrastructure gaps
content: The panchayat lacks a community hall or common gathering space, making it difficult for residents to host events or take shelter during adverse weather

title: Jagan condemns attack on Dalit student at Tirupati
content: The YSRCP President demands that a police case be registered on the incident and action taken against the assailants

title: Tamil Nadu’s endangered species fund hits a snag; AIWC to now manage ₹50 crore corpus
content: Advanced Institute of Wildlife Conservation in Vandalur is an institution known for its research and initiatives in wildlife conservation

title: G. Sudhakaran criticises police for registering case against him over postal ballot-tampering remarks
content: CPI(M) leader says he said “negative things to create a positive effect,” and that tampering of votes never happened

title: Preparations underway for Kailash Mansarovar Yatra from Sikkim after five years
content: Two acclimatisation centres are being established between state capital Gangtok and Nathu La, while functional toilets and other travel-related infrastructure are also being developed for the pilgrims, said MLA Thinlay Tshering Bhutia.

title: Historian urges Chief Minister to preserve ancient Vaishnavite temple in Sathya Sai district
content: Gudipalli was once a prominent Vaishnavite center during the reign of the Hoysalas and the Vijayanagara Empire, and was regarded as one of the 108 important temples in South India, says historian MyNaa Swamy

title: Constitution of India supreme, its pillars must work together: CJI Gavai
content: The Chief Justice said he was glad that the country has not just strengthened but has also developed on the social and economic fronts and continues to do so

title: T.N. Government should take up infrastructure works in government schools during summer holidays: G.K. Vasan
content: G.K. Vasan said that to improve the quality of education and increase the pass percentage, teachers’ vacancies should be filled without any delay

title: TN government lists out achievements in agri, dairy, fisheries sectors
content: Tamil Nadu ranked first in India in the productivity of finger millet (ragi) and guava and held the second position in the country in the productivity of maize, sugarcane, tamarind, tapioca, jasmine, and oilseeds

title: False caste claims: Issue of Lingayat-Jangamas claiming to be Beda Jangamas to get reservation benefit comes to fore again
content: “It has come to notice in recent years that Veerashaiva-Linagayat Jangamas are taking caste certificate and enjoying the benefit of reservation,” Minister K.H. Muniyappa said

title: Stalin requests CMs to oppose Presidential reference; underlines need to evolve a coordinated legal strategy
content: Mr. Stalin wrote to CMs of Himachal Pradesh, Jharkhand, Karnataka, Kerala, Punjab, Telangana, West Bengal and the Union territory of Jammu and Kashmir on May 17, Saturday.

title: Agitating teachers' protest outside Bengal education department HQ continues for 4th straight day
content: “We will not leave this spot till Minister Bratya Basu comes here and assures us that we will not have to write the exam again. Our representation and views should be accommodated in the special review petition to be filed by the State Government in the Supreme Court,” Chinmoy Mondal, a representative of the teachers’ forum told.

title: Hyderabad Gulzar Houz fire accident: ‘We are trapped, please save us’, best friend recalls victim’s phone call as inferno raged
content: Syed Iqbal, a bangle seller and the family’s close friend for more than two decades, was the first to receive a call when fire broke out in the building

title: Hyderabad Gulzar Houz fire: Men returning from namaz turn saviours, say ‘we broke a wall to get in’
content: Without a moment’s hesitation — and before the first fire tenders had even arrived — Mir Zahed and Mohd Azmath barged into the building, determined to help

title: Bahujan Samaj Party appoints Akash Anand as chief national coordinator
content: Bahujan Samaj Party chief Mayawati hoped that this time her nephew Akash Anand would strengthen the ideological foundations of the BSP

title: Hyderabad Gulzar Houz fire: Tears, chaos and questions at Osmania General Hospital mortuary after fire tragedy
content: Outside the mortuary of Osmania General Hospital, emotions ran high as families, barred from entering, clung to each other for comfort

title: Top priority given to maintenance of tanks, check dam, says Parvatipuram-Manyam Collector A. Shyam Prasad
content: The initiative is expected to benefit a large number of farmers as a majority of areas in the district come under rain-fed zone, the Collector said

title: Guns N’ Roses back; Mumbai showers love for ‘November Rain’
content: American legendary hard rock band, Guns N’ Roses, delivered a powerhouse performance in Mumbai after 13 years, their second time India after their debut in 2012.

title: Stop misusing patriotism as a political weapon: Assam Congress to CM Himanta Biswa Sarma
content: The party slammed the Chief Minister for trying to target MP Gaurav Gogoi’s wife with vague accusations

title: Man jumps into Krishna River to escape from police, drowns
content: However, Thotlavallur SI Ch. Avinash said that Gopala Rao, who went for fishing drowned in Krishna River

title: Karnataka MLA warns of Pakistan nationals in twin cities Hubballi, Dharwad
content: Aravind Bellad said he had reports of unknown and suspicious people from various countries, including Pakistan, roaming around in mosques and other places

title: ‘A wrong perception is being spread in Tamil Nadu about NEP,’ alleges Tamilisai Soundararajan
content: Tamilisai criticised the release of the book ‘National Education Policy, 2020 – A Rogue Elephant’, authored by School Education Minister Anbil Mahesh Poyyamozhi and unveiled by CM Stalin

title: West Bengal railway stations see overhaul under Amrit Bharat Scheme
content: An investment of over ₹3 crore has gone into improvements ranging from safety features to passenger services

title: He Killed Man Who Harassed His Sister, Arrested 6 Months Later In Delhi
content: The Crime Branch of Delhi Police has arrested a man wanted in connection with a murder case that occurred in Narela six months ago.

title: Single Entry, Closed Windows: What Led To 18 Deaths In Hyderabad Fire
content: The death of 17 members of a family, including eight children, in a massive fire has left people shocked in Hyderabad.

title: Indian PhD Graduate Facing Deportation Wins Legal Battle To Stay In US
content: Priya Saxena, an Indian PhD student at a university in South Dakota, whom the Trump administration has been attempting to deport from the United States, has won a legal reprieve from a federal court, allowing her to stay in America.

title: India Emerges As Bright Spot In UN Report Amid Global Economic Slowdown
content: At a time when the global economy is facing what the United Nations calls a "precarious moment", India has emerged as a rare bright spot.

title: UK Judge Notes "Confidential Impediment" In Nirav Modi Extradition Case
content: A London High Court judge who refused Nirav Modi's latest bail application this week has taken note in his judgment of a "confidential impediment" in the long-drawn extradition proceedings against the imprisoned diamantaire wanted in India.

title: Tejashwi Yadav Finds Hidden Agenda In Ex-Minister Joining Prashant Kishor's Party
content: The merger of former Union Minister RCP Singh's party with Prashant Kishor's Jan Suraaj Party has stirred the political pot in Bihar, with RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav claiming a hidden agenda behind the move.

title: "My Tuition Being Used To Fund Genocide": US Student's Graduation Speech
content: A George Washington University (GWU) graduate has slammed the institution's financial ties to Israel and its role in what she called the "genocide" in Gaza.

title: Investigating Odisha YouTuber's Links With 'Pak Spy' Jyoti Malhotra: Police
content: The Odisha Police have started an investigation into alleged links between a Puri-based YouTuber and Jyoti Malhotra, who was arrested on the charge of passing on sensitive information to Pakistani intelligence operatives, an officer said on Sunday.

title: "3 Pillars Of Democracy Equal": Chief Justice BR Gavai's Big Protocol Remark
content: The Chief Justice, who took over the country's top judicial post last month and became the second Dalit to be elevated to the post, attended a felicitation ceremony in Mumbai and then visited Babasaheb Ambedkar's memorial Chaitya Bhoomi.

title: "Criminal": Elton John Slams UK Government's AI Copyright Plans
content: Elton John on Sunday accused the British government of "committing theft" by proposing that tech firms could train artificial intelligence models on the UK's music and creative output without guaranteeing proper recompense.

title: "Warned Against Misuse": Sharad Pawar On Change In Anti-Money Laundering Law
content: Veteran politician Sharad Pawar said today that he had warned former Prime Minister Manmohan Singh and his UPA government about the amendments in the PMLA, and the possibilities of their abuse under a different government.

title: Israel's Netanyahu Says Open To "End Fighting" In Gaza If Hamas Does This
content: In an apparent shift in approach, Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has indicated that Tel Aviv was open to a deal with Hamas to "end the fighting" in Gaza, laying out conditions for such an agreement.

title: 'Her Trips Defy Sources Of Income': Police On 'Spy' YouTuber Jyoti Malhotra Who Visited Pakistan
content: The case of social media influencer Jyoti Malhotra, who has been arrested on charges of spying for Pakistan, is a big example of how modern warfare does not necessarily mean fighting at the border, a senior police officer in Haryana's Hisar said.

title: How Asaduddin Owaisi Went From Political Loner To India Mascot In 3 Weeks
content: On April 24, two days after the terror attack in Jammu and Kashmir's Pahalgam, AIMIM chief and Hyderabad MP took to X to protest against being left out of the all-party meeting

title: Russia Launches Biggest Drone Attack On Ukraine Since Start Of War
content: Russia overnight into Sunday launched its most intense drone attack on Ukraine since the beginning of its full-scale invasion in 2022, after the first direct talks between Moscow and Kyiv in years failed to yield a ceasefire.

title: "Woman Hugged Children, Burned In Embrace": What Hyderabad Fire Saviour Saw
content: Shortly after a fire broke out in a home in the busy market area near Hyderabad's Charminar, local residents rushed in as first responders and started bringing out those trapped inside.

title: Video: Deadly Tornadoes Shred Homes In Midwest US, 27 Killed, Dozens Injured
content: An unstable spring weather system spawned several tornadoes overnight in the United States' Midwest and Ohio River Valley, killing at least 27 people, and leaving dozens of others injured in Missouri, Kentucky and Virginia.

title: NDTV Exclusive: Rows Of Body Bags - Gaza Bleeds As Israel Unleashes Gideon's Chariot
content: Outside the many makeshift 'tent hospitals' scattered across Gaza, rows of body bags lie on the ground. Grief-stricken people move from tent to tent, searching desperately for missing family.

title: Powerplay By Turkey? Erdogan Grabbing Macron's Finger Makes Headlines
content: French President Emmanuel Macron and his Turkish counterpart, Recep Tayyip Erdogan, shared an unusual interaction during the European Political Community (EPC) summit in Tirana that has sparked buzz online.

title: Ashoka University associate professor Ali Khan Mahmudabad arrested for social media posts in the wake of ‘Operation Sindoor’
content: The arrest comes days after the Haryana State Commission for Women sent a notice to the associate professor over his Operation Sindoor remarks

title: Congress hails Indira Gandhi's decisive leadership on first Nuclear test anniversary
content: On this day in 1974, India conducted its first nuclear test in Pokhran, code-named Operation Smiling Buddha. With this India had entered the league of nations with nuclear capabilities.

title: Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah’s visit to Shivamogga, Chikkamagaluru cancelled owing to weather condition
content: A communique from the CM’s office stated that the CM Siddaramaiah would not be travelling to Chikkamagaluru and Shivamogga on the day owing to inevitable reasons

title: CM Revanth, Opposition leaders express shock and grief over Hyderabad fire mishap; Officials urged to take swift steps
content: At least 10 people were killed and several others sustained injuries in the incident happened on May 18; CM assured all possible efforts would be made to rescue those trapped and support the affected families

title: Hyderabad fire LIVE updates: At least 17 killed in fire at a building in Gulzar Houz near Charminar
content: Narrow entrances, one to the first floor home and another wider one to the enclosed shopping space led to the disastrously high toll near Hyderabad’s Charminar; PM announces ex-gratia

title: BJP keeps winning because opposition is a failure: Owaisi
content: Owaisi cautioned that India cannot achieve the "Viksit Bharat" goal by 2047 by keeping such a large community marginalised and weak

title: 'Act of depravity': Congress slams govt over 'mismatch' in COVID-19 pandemic deaths
content: Gujarat has achieved the dubious distinction of undercounting deaths on a staggering scale, 33 times more deaths were reported than acknowledged by the Gujarat Government, said Congress’ Jairam Ramesh

title: Former Nitish Kumar aide R.C.P. Singh merges party with Prashant Kishor’s Jan Suraaj Party
content: Estranged aide of Chief Minister Nitish Kumar, Ramchandra Prasad Singh merged his newly floated party App Sabki Aawaz into Jan Suraaj Party

title: Charminar fire accident: Two narrow entrances blamed for high toll
content: “If the persons had rushed to the terrace the toll could have been lower. The narrow entrance hampered our operations though we reached within few minutes,” an official said

title: Manipur riots accused held by NIA in Thalassery disguised as health workers
content: He is reportedly trained by the proscribed United National Liberation Front (UNLF), a banned militant group

title: Puri Jagannath temple urges devotees not to consume 'Mahaprasad' on dining tables
content: The appeal follows reports and social media showing people eating the 'Mahaprasad' in a hotel in Puri while seated at tables and wearing shoes — an act the SJTA described as "against the age-old traditions of Sri Mandir."

title: Forest Deparment officials clear encroachment of 27 acres in Channarayapatna taluk in Karnataka’s Hassan district
content: Following a complaint about the illegal grant of 26 acres and 33 guntas of land at survey number 27 of Madaba, Karnataka Forest Minister Eshwar Khandre had ordered the clearing of the encroachment

title: News in Frames: Tracking the kings
content: During the 16th Lion Population Estimation 2025, volunteers and forest officials document a thriving lion population across Greater Gir

title: Hyderabad Gulzar Houz fire accident: At least 17 dead; victims suffered severe burns, inhalation injuries
content: So far, 15 bodies have arrived at the mortuary, with the remaining expected to be brought in shortly

title: Congress surveys economic hardship of Assam people ahead of Assembly polls
content: In Congress, everyone is concerned for Assam, and the central leadership is giving utmost importance to the State, says Charan Singh Sapra

title: Four militants arrested in Manipur
content: The arrested man was allegedly involved in extortion in Thoubal District. A handgun, along with ammunition, was recovered from his possession, police said

title: Youth arrested in Haryana's Nuh for spying for Pakistan, say police
content: The accused was arrested for sharing information related to the Indian Army and other military activities with Pakistan through an employee posted at the High Commission of Pakistan in Delhi, Nuh police said

title: A city in transition: From Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike to Greater Bengaluru Authority
content: The GBA aims to fix systemic inefficiencies by creating a unified governance structure that can deliver integrated planning and services

title: ‘Misrepresentation of facts’: MEA clarifies Jaishankar’s ‘warned Pakistan at the start’ of Operation Sindoor remark
content: The clarification came after Rahul Gandhi’s criticism of the government suggesting that the Indian side informed Pakistan ahead of the military strikes on terrorist infrastructure in Pakistan and PoK

title: Homemaker duped of over ₹2.79 lakh with fake children’s talent contest
content: The scam unfolded on May 12, 2025, when the victim was contacted via Facebook by a user operating under the name ‘Erica Wally’.

title: The monsoon’s green energy potential
content: Monsoons are strong drivers of climate: their cool, gusty winds can be predicted and modelled just as rains can be

title: Did Trump cross the line on Kashmir issue? | Explained
content: What are the contours of Indian foreign policy with regard to Jammu and Kashmir? What has the U.S. President said? What has been the experience in the past? What is the stand adopted by India and Pakistan? Is a dialogue with Pakistan possible?

title: Vikram Misri | Face of counter-attack
content: The Foreign Secretary’s adept handling of Operation Sindoor won the praise of colleagues and friends but also exposed him to online trolls

title: Kasturi Ranga Iyengar Charitable Trust donates e-carts to Oppiliappan Temple, govt. hospital
content: Trust Chairperson Dr. Nalini Krishnan hands over 15 sewing machines to women at Innambur near Kumbakonam

title: Minister Lokesh and his family meet PM Modi
content: Mr. Modi unveiled the first copy of the coffee table book Yuvagalam which chronicles the historic 3,132 km padayatra taken out by Mr. Lokesh in the run up to the 2024 elections

title: AAI may take over operation of the multi-level car parking facility at city airport for now
content: The move comes amid complaints over cab pick-up points and congestion of vehicles at entry/exit areas; the existing contractor has given termination notice to AAI due to losses

title: Civil society organisations demand judicial enquiry into Pahalgam terror attack in letter to PM Modi
content: Hate-mongering via media and social media, which fuels distrust and communalism, must be curbed immediately, the statement said

title: Govt. Taluk Hospital in Vaniyambadi inundated after heavy downpour
content: Municipal officials say the hospital is located in a low-lying area near Kannamapudur lake that is heavily encroached upon; its drains are small and built several years ago

title: Major reshuffle in Trinamool’s rank and file, two heavyweights replaced
content: The two organisational districts where the presidents have been replaced by core committees are Birbhum and Kolkata (Uttar), which had several complaints of infighting

title: T.N. will file case against the Centre in SC for withholding funds over language policy: Stalin
content: Releasing a book on the NEP, authored by Minister Anbil Mahesh Poyyamozhi, he says the funds rightfully belong to the State as recommended by the Parliamentary Standing Committee on Education, headed by former M.P. Chief Minister and Congress MP Digvijay Singh

title: Heavy rain in Bengaluru causes chaos, more showers expected till May 21
content: As per the IMD, parts of Karnataka are likely to witness heavy showers and thunderstorms on Sunday, with gusty winds reaching speeds of 40–50 kmph

title: Age concession for direct recruitment into T.N. government service to remain till September 2026
content: In a recent communication, Chief Secretary N. Muruganandam clarified that the decision was a “one-time concession” and added that this would be applicable only to recruitment by various agencies and appointing authorities

title:
Shift in ecosystem of Parambikulam
forests through the eyes of tribes
content: In a seminar held as part of a government initiative, tribespeople have aired concerns regarding the disproportionate surge in peacock population as well as decline of the once-common hump-nosed vipers in the area

title: Application fee for colleges: A tad more than what is necessary
content: The Comptroller Auditor-General’s report on higher education, which was tabled in the Assembly during the recent Budget session, advised the Directorate of Collegiate Education to ensure that self-financing colleges abide by its instructions on application fees. R. Sujatha takes a deep dive to figure out the reality in colleges in Tamil Nadu

title: Pakistan-linked ghost SIM card racket busted in Assam

title: Member states pledge troops and support to UN peace keeping missions at Berlin Ministerial
content: The Ministerial comes at a time when the world body is undergoing major internal restructuring, facing major funding cuts by the U.S. and Europe’s increased military spending.

title: All-party delegation to convey India’s united message against terrorism marred by partisan politics

title: APSDMA launches ‘Smart Heat Alert Card’ that gives real-time temperatures and dos and don’ts

title: India curbs Bangladeshi exports via land ports
